title: Ucy
author: Ucy
content: What section of the forum is somewhere between Serious Discussions (about 40% Bitcoin/crypto related discussions), Off-topics and allowed-to-post by Campaign Managers?Do we have such section yet? The section will likely attract most of my posts and I would move majority of my old important posts there, all for more comments from high quality posters participating in signature campaigns. By high quality posters I mean members whose posts are honest/true, very important, deep/imaginative, useful, sound, creative/knowledge-based, evidence-based, etc How do we solve this if such section does not exist yet?

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: If I understand correctly, you're asking for a section where discsuopns are kept serious and highly moderated, similar to the serious discussion and ivory tower board. But signatures are allowed regardless and it's not for a specific niche, like Development & Technical Discussions.Quote from: Ucy on August 15, 2022, 09:44:31 AMHow do we solve this if such section does not exist yet?AFAIK, such a section does not exist and for it to, we need to have extreme levels of moderation on the existing boards. (I believe existing boards, like Bitcoin Discussions or Economics would fit the idea, if it had less spam)Signatures normally attracts all type of posters as there are bounties/campaigns for different users, majority of which are spammers, so strict moderation would be necessary.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: First of all, you can't move posts, you can move your threads. What sub-board they belong to depends on the subject being discussed. It's difficult to answer without knowing what threads you are thinking of moving and where. Also, some threads can fit in multiple boards and moderators can have different interpretations what the perfect board for a thread is.The best thing would be if you could list the threads you want to move, state where you would like to move them, and then we (including staff) can share our feedback if that is the way to go.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: What OP is actually looking for is a board where he can open topics that he otherwise opens in Off-topic and P&S, and that this board will be one of those that will be among those where posts are counted when it comes to signatures campaign. In other words, his idea boils down to how to present his content, which is fundamentally off-topic or deals with politics, to members who are not interested in such things.I would like there to be a board that could perhaps be called "My fairy tales" so that everyone who has some strange ideas and imaginations can enjoy their fantasies without hindrance - for example, "how to influence the price of Bitcoin with my posts"

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on August 15, 2022, 12:09:23 PM<Snip> Wow, just wow. I just read the trust feedback you posted on his account. I wasn't familiar with this user or his style of writing, and I actually thought he was being serious. One might even call it a mental instability. How else would you describe a person claiming he is responsible for "moving" the price of bitcoin from $19k to $40k? If that's the direction this discussion is heading towards, I would say off-topic, P&S, or even archival are the perfect locations.

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: Quote from: Ucy on August 15, 2022, 09:44:31 AMWhat section of the forum is somewhere between Serious Discussions (about 40% Bitcoin/crypto related discussions), Off-topics and allowed-to-post by Campaign Managers?No section. If it fits both the Serious and Off-topic discussion, it isn't allowed or isn't counted by (most?) campaign managers. Making a Serious Discussion thread means you pretty much want to discuss something outside this forum, so it's normal to not count. Quote from: Pmalek on August 15, 2022, 11:40:10 AMFirst of all, you can't move posts, you can move your threads.Actually, it's possible to move posts, but AFAIK, only moderators can do it.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: BlackHatCoiner on August 15, 2022, 05:03:03 PMActually, it's possible to move posts, but AFAIK, only moderators can do it. Hmm, I didn't know that. I have never seen it happen though, but I wouldn't be surprised there is such an option. However, my previous reply remains accurate in the sense that OP can't move his posts. He could request and report them to be moved, but I seriously doubt the staff would bother moving posts from Off-topic to Serious Discussion or similar less important sub boards. Such functionalities are probably reserved only for quality contributions that would be a better fit elsewhere.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Quote from: Ucy on August 15, 2022, 09:44:31 AMWhat section of the forum is somewhere between Serious Discussions (about 40% Bitcoin/crypto related discussions), Off-topics and allowed-to-post by Campaign Managers?I tried my best to actually understand what you meant in Op. It's difficult to accurately understand, because it seems you are not making sense here. Let me analyse this;First, you want a board that is neither Serious Discussion nor Off topic, then what will be discussed in the board is 40% bitcoin related and 60% off topic, and then signature quota will count there. What you are asking for is an off topic promax board , where someone can officially spam and fantasise. There is no kind of discussion that would be more serious than bitcoin discussion in a bitcoin forum. Again, someone seeking for a serious discussion shouldn't be mindful of posts count, so Off topic best fits your idea if it's not related to bitcoin.

comments.author: Welsh
comments.body: The 60% off topic posts can go in off topic, and the 40% Bitcoin related threads can go in the most suitable Bitcoin section. We aren't going to make a new section to accommodate this. I think sometimes it gets forgotten, but signature campaigns exist on Bitcointalk, they aren't part of the rule set or influence our decisions on a moderation stand point. Therefore, changes aren't likely to be made with signature campaigns in mind, unless it's directly addressing the issues that signature campaigns cause. For example, spam getting so bad that they're eventually banned. Obviously, theymos has stated they don't want to do that unless absolutely necessary. Only post in serious discussion if it's (for a lack of a better word) serious . Nah, if it's of high quality, and you want to generally receive more serious, and higher quality replies.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Remember this is bitcointalk still it allows people to discuss everything what they wanted so how can you complain that we need a dedicated board for discussing threads which is not related to cryptocurrencies but still show the signature so we can get paid from the campaign and not really contributing towards the cryptocurrencies.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: I kinda feel like everyone is missing out on a big point here. OP, you should not concern yourself with whether or not your posts will count towards a paid campaign. I mean what's a few bucks to an influencer such as yourself? You can send bitcoin over 40k if you want right? Will you not post if your ideas will not count towards a campaign post count? You should be posting casually having fun on the forum and helping bitcoin advance. If you happen to make a few bucks while doing so, then it should be considered a bonus.
